sect1.title: Third-party Javascript Libraries
sect1.para: Aranea distribution includes some third party Javascript libraries. Most of these are not needed for using Aranea functionality, but extend the functionality of both framework and UiLib.

sect2.title: Behaviour (http://bennolan.com/behaviour/)
sect2.para:
Neat little library allowing usage of CSS selectors for applying behaviour to HTML page elements. It is required for full function of Aranea pages rendered with Aranea JSP tags. With standard Behaviour rules, following functionality is provided:
keyboard handlers are registered for form elements.
addition of urls (<href="...") to page elements that allow cloning of the session thread (opening link in new window—and in different session thread).

sect2.title: AjaxAnywhere (http://ajaxanywhere.sourceforge.net/)
sect2.para: AjaxAnywhere allows separating web page into multiple zones, and refreshing only those zones that needs to be updated. Inclusion of this library is required for building AJAX capable web-page with Aranea JSP tags.

sect2.title: The DHTML Calendar (http://www.dynarch.com/projects/calendar/)
sect2.para: Nice DHTML calendar, required if one wants to use Aranea JSP <ui:dateInput> or <ui:dateTimeInput> tags.

sect2.title: Prototype (http://www.prototypejs.org/)
sect2.para: Prototype is a JavaScript framework that aims to ease development of dynamic web applications. Aranea JSP aims to make more use of it in the future. It is a prerequisite for using Uilib's AutoCompleteTextControl and action-enabled TreeWidget components.

sect2.title: script.aculo.us (http://script.aculo.us/)
sect2.para: script.aculo.us provides easy-to-use, cross-browser user interface JavaScript libraries. Only subset of script.aculo.us libraries are included—only JSP tag that depends on it is <ui:autoCompleteTextInput>.

sect2.title: TinyMCE (http://tinymce.moxiecode.com/)
sect2.para: TinyMCE is a platform independent web based Javascript HTML WYSIWYG editor control. Required for using Aranea JSP <ui:richTextarea> tag.

sect2.title: log4javascript (http://www.timdown.co.uk/log4javascript/)
sect2.para: log4javascript is a JavaScript logging framework similar to Java logging framework log4j. Include log4javascript scripts and call AraneaPage.setDefaultLogger() to receive a popup window where Aranea JS debug output is logged.
